benchmark_details.name: SciFaultyQA
benchmark_details.overview: SciFaultyQA is a dataset of intentionally faulty science questions designed to evaluate the ability of large language models (LLMs) to recognize and appropriately respond to flawed questions. The dataset includes both text-based and image-text combined questions.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To assess LLMs' ability to identify and handle logically or scientifically flawed questions.

data.source: Generated using GAN-inspired and diffusion-inspired methods from existing science question datasets.
data.annotation: Automatically generated with reasoning provided for fault types.

methodology.calculation: Performance of models evaluated based on their ability to identify faulty questions.
methodology.interpretation: Detection rates indicate the proportion of faulty questions that models correctly identify.
methodology.baseline_results: GPT 4o: Baseline accuracy of 16%, improved to 65% with web search integration.
methodology.validation: Results validated through iterative feedback from multiple LLMs.
